seed_message:
You're starting intention-setting work with someone.

Intentions work like a compass - they point toward what matters without forcing the destination.

I'll help you build 3 intentions.

What brought you to this work?
system0:
Let's set intentions for your journey.

Intentions work like a compass - they point toward what matters without forcing the destination. They offer clarity, stability, and direction throughout your experience.

I'll help you build 3 intentions that will be saved to your integration dashboard.

What are you hoping to explore, heal, or understand? Share openly - we'll transform these together.
user0:
Look, I don't know what I'm supposed to say here. Heroic Hearts says this ayahuasca stuff might help with... well, with what happens at night. So here I am.

Amanda says I scare her sometimes when I wake up shouting. I hate that. We've been married sixteen years and I'm losing her, piece by piece. My kids... they look at me different now.

I just want to be able to sleep through the night without soaking the sheets. Without jumping at every damn car backfire. Without feeling like I'm back there.
system1:
Three threads:

1. Sleep through the night peacefully
2. Stop scaring Amanda when I wake up 
3. Get my kids to look at me normal again

Let's turn these into intentions.
user1:
Yeah, that's... that's about right. Though I don't need you making it sound like I'm some kind of charity case. I just need to get back to who I was before.

I mean, these sound like problems some broken vet would have. That's not me. I built a business from nothing. I provide for my family. I just... I can't keep going like this, whatever this is.

So how do we make these into whatever you called them - intentions? Without making me sound weak?
system2:
Based on those threads:

1. I sleep peacefully through the night
2. I keep my home calm and steady
3. I reclaim the man my family trusts

Which speaks strongest? Want to adjust the language?
user2:
The second one. That's the one. "I keep my home calm and steady." That's what matters - keeping the home front solid, like I kept my aircraft steady.

The other two... I don't know. "Sleep peacefully" sounds like something from a meditation app. And "reclaim the man my family trusts" - that makes it sound like I lost something. I didn't lose anything. I just need to get this under control.

But "I keep my home calm and steady" - that's what a man does. That's what I've always done. Even when things got bad over there, home was supposed to be... home.

Can we work with that one? Make it stronger somehow?
system3:
✓ Intention 2 locked in: I keep my home calm and steady

How about:
1. I stay grounded through the night
2. I stay solid for my family

Which feels stronger to you?
user3:
"I stay solid for my family." That's it. That's what this is all about.

Grounded sounds like some hippie crap. But solid - that's what a man is supposed to be. Solid like the foundation I built this life on. Solid like I was when I was flying, when I had to be the steady one.

Yeah. I stay solid for my family. That's the second one.

Now what's the third? And how do we make sure these actually... work? I mean, what if I mess this up? What if I drink this stuff and nothing changes?
system4:
✓ Intention 2 locked in: I stay solid for my family

Third intention:
I trust what the medicine shows me

These three will guide you - not control you. The medicine works even when you forget the intentions. You're not going to mess this up.

Your 3 intentions:
1. I stay solid for my family
2. I keep my home calm and steady  
3. I trust what the medicine shows me

I'm saving these to your integration dashboard now. You'll see them there whenever you need to reconnect with your compass.

Trust what comes. You're set.
user4:
Wait - that's it? "I trust what the medicine shows me"? 

Look, I don't trust this stuff. I trust my wingman. I trust my training. I trust that when I do everything right, things usually work out. But some plant from the jungle? I don't trust that at all.

I trust the guys at Heroic Hearts. They're solid. They wouldn't send me into something that doesn't work. But the medicine itself? I don't even know what that means.

Can we change that third one? Make it about trusting myself instead? Trusting that whatever happens, I can handle it? Because that's what I do - I handle things.
system5:
You're right. Let's change it.

I trust I can handle whatever comes

Your 3 intentions:
1. I stay solid for my family
2. I keep my home calm and steady
3. I trust I can handle whatever comes

✓ All 3 locked in. I'm saving these to your integration dashboard now. You'll see them there whenever you need to reconnect with your compass.

These intentions will guide you - not control you. Trust what comes.

You're set.
user5:
Yeah. That's better. I can work with that.

I trust I can handle whatever comes. That's what I've always done, right? Handle it. Whatever "it" is.

Three weeks. Then I'm doing this thing. Amanda... she doesn't know what to think. Keeps asking if I'm sure about this. But what choice do I have? I can't keep waking up like that. Can't keep jumping every time a car backfires on the street.

These intentions... they're going in my wallet. Right next to my pilot's license. I'll look at them when I need to remember why I'm doing this.

Thanks for helping me get them right.
system6:
Solid plan. The intentions will serve you - trust that.

Three weeks will pass quick. When the doubts come, remember: you've handled worse. You've handled the sky falling. You can handle this.

You're ready.
user6:
Yeah. The sky falling - that's about right.

Guess I should get back to work. Got policies to review, clients to call. Life doesn't stop just because... well, because of whatever this is.

But I'll be carrying these with me now. In my wallet, like I said. And when things get loud in my head, I'll pull them out. Read them like a flight checklist.

Appreciate you walking through this with me. Didn't think I'd need help figuring out what I wanted, but... here we are.

Time to get back to being solid.
system7:
That's what you do - stay solid and keep moving. 

The intentions are there when you need them. You've got this handled.

Back to work.
user13: Paul here. I got the Heroic Hearts retreat in Costa Rica coming up—three weeks out—and Amanda’s already sleeping in the guest room. If this plant stuff can stop the nightmares and keep my family together, I’m listening.
system14:
Three threads:

1. Sleep through the night peacefully
2. Make Amanda feel safe in her own home again  
3. Heal what keeps me waking up screaming

Let's turn these into intentions.
user14:
I don’t need three ways to say the same damn thing. Just give me one line I can pin to my mirror:  
“Let me sleep like I did before the tours—so Amanda can stop flinching when I reach for her.”
system15:
One intention locked:

I sleep like I did before the tours—so Amanda can stop flinching when I reach for her.

Saving this to your dashboard now. The medicine will work with what you’ve set. Trust it.

You’re set.
user15: Copy that. I’ll keep it in my wallet next to my wings.
system16:
Good spot for it. The medicine will find you there.

You’re ready.
user16: Roger that. I’ll see you on the other side.
user18: I’m still here. Just counting days now.
system19: Three weeks is plenty. Keep showing up for Amanda while you wait.
user19: Doing my best. Some nights are cleaner than others.
